meanings.definition: To compare or represent as similar
meanings.sent1: She likened the two flowers to show their similarities.
meanings.sent2: People often liken the taste of lemons to that of limes.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly likened his messy room to a jungle.
meanings.sent4: The artist likened the sunset to a painting in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a clever analogy to liken math problems to puzzles.

meanings.definition: To consider or regard as similar
meanings.sent1: I liken her to a ray of sunshine because of her bright personality.
meanings.sent2: Many people liken the sound of rain to a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent3: The child likened his broccoli to tiny trees on his plate.
meanings.sent4: She likened his singing voice to that of a nightingale.
meanings.sent5: The author cleverly likened the city to a living, breathing organism in her book.

meanings.definition: To make or cause to be like
meanings.sent1: The new software update will liken the interface to that of a smartphone.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a special seasoning to liken the taste of the dish to a traditional recipe.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to liken a coin to a disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The coach likened the team's strategy to a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's skillful stitching could liken any garment to a work of art.
